Temptation.Description: P has to make a moral choice between right and wrong.

The Riddle.Description: P has to solve a puzzle or a crime.

Metamorphosis.Description: P literally changes into something else (i.e. a werewolf, hulk, giant cockroach).

Rescue.Description: P must save someone who is trapped physically or emotionally.

Tragedy.Description: P is brought down by a fatal flaw in their character or by forces out of their control.
Tragedy.ExampleOne: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Love.Description: A couple meet and overcome obstacles to discover true love. Or - tragically - don't.

Monster Force.Description: A monster / alien / something scary and supernatural must be fought and overcome.

Revenge.Description: P retaliates against another for a real or imagined injury.

Transformation.Description: P lives through a series of events that change them as a person.

Fish Out Of Water.Description: P tries to cope in a completely different place/time/world.

Maturation.Description: P has a experience that matures them or starts a new stage of life, often adulthood.

Pursuit.Description: P has to chase somebody or something, usually in a hide-and-seek fashion.

Rivalry.Description: P must triumph over a adversary to attain an object or goal.

Underdog.Description: Total loser faces overwhelming odds but wins in the end.

Discovery.Description: Through a major upheaval, P discovers a truth about themselves and a better understanding of life.

Escape.Description: P trapped by antagonistic forces and must escape. Pronto.

Journey and Return.Description: P goes on a physical journey and returns changed.

Comedy.Description: A series of complications lead P into ridiculous situations.

Quest.Description: P searches for a person, place or thing, overcoming a number of challenges.

Sacrifice.Description: P must make a difficult choice between pleasing themselves or a higher purpose (e.g. love, honour).

Wretched Excess.Description: P pushes the limits of acceptable behaviour, destroying themselves in the process.
